channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A two-run lead was starting to slip away from the Los Angeles Dodgers in the ninth inning — along with their chance to force the World Series to Game 7.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Blue Jays' Max Scherzer gets second World Series Game 7 start after Dodgers force winner-take-all
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Max Scherzer is about to become the only living pitcher to start a winner-take-all World Series Game 7 for a second time.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Jazz get burned by the Suns, 118-96
item.description: PHOENIX (ABC4 Sports) - The Utah Jazz fell in an early hole they could not climb out of in a 118-96 loss to the Phoenix Suns Friday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts says Shohei Ohtani a possibility to start Game 7 of World Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani might start Game 7 of the World Series on Saturday. Tyler Glasnow might pitch on back-to-back days. For Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts, the only certainty is that Yoshinobu Yamamoto won't pitch. Besides that? "Everyone will be available," Roberts said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Giddey, Vucevic lead Bulls past Knicks 135-125 and a 5-0 start
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Josh Giddey scored a career-high 32 points with 10 rebounds and nine assists, Nikola Vucevic added 26 points, and the Chicago Bulls beat the New York Knicks 135-125 on Friday night to stay undefeated and get out to their best start in nearly three decades.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps: 'We are trying our hardest' to settle antitrust lawsuit
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps said Friday “we are trying our hardest” to settle the federal antitrust lawsuit with the two teams suing the racing series in the most expansive comments yet from the defendants.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Jaguars place two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve with a right knee injury
item.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — The Jacksonville Jaguars placed two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve Friday because of a knee injury. Coach Liam Coen announced the move a day after Hunter injured his right knee in practice.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: NFL cracks down on Ravens with major fine tied to Lamar Jackson injury report
item.description: The NFL reportedly fined the Baltimore Ravens $100,000 for violating the league's injury report policy last week involving star quarterback Lamar Jackson.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Warriors center Trayce Jackson-Davis, in best shape of his life, returns to home state
item.description: Trayce Jackson-Davis was Indiana's boys high school basketball player of the year and also starred collegiately at Indiana.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Dycus, The Mercury News

item.title: Quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against Seahawks on Sunday night
item.description: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Washington quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday night. Daniels, hampered by an injured right hamstring, missed his third game of the season on Monday night when the Commanders fell 28-7 to the Kansas City Chiefs.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Zverev saves match points to set up Sinner semifinal at Paris Masters
item.description: Alexander Zverev has saved two match points to overcame Daniil Medvedev 2-6, 6-3, 7-6 and keep alive his Paris Masters title defense.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Early knockout: Los Gatos scores TDs on its first two plays, routs M-A
item.description: Los Gatos rolls past Menlo-Atherton to improve to 4-0 in Peninsula Athletic League Bay Division play.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Reeves, The Mercury News

item.title: Blue Jays 1 win away from ending 32-year World Series championship drought
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from capturing their first World Series title in 32 years and will take on the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 6 of the Fall Classic on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trey Hendrickson, Breece Hall among biggest names who could be moved before the NFL's trade deadline
item.description: Christian McCaffrey, Roquan Smith and Von Miller were the best trade deadline acquisitions over the past four years. NFL teams looking to bolster their playoff hopes for a run at the Super Bowl have until 4 p.m. ET on Tuesday to make a trade. Of course, it takes two to make a deal.
item.dc:creator: ROB MAADDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: With Gausman and Yamamoto, the splitter is back in the spotlight for World Series Game 6
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Mr. Splitty has returned. Showcased by World Series Game 6 starters Kevin Gausman and Yoshinobu Yamamoto, split-finger fastballs have been used for 6.8% of postseason pitches this year, more than double last year's 2.4% and up from 1.5% when pitch tracking started in 2008.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Lamar Jackson torches Miami with 4 TD passes in return from injury and Ravens rout Dolphins 28-6
item.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — Lamar Jackson returned for the Baltimore Ravens, and so did the chants of “M-V-P!” — on the road. Jackson threw for 204 yards and four touchdowns, showing little rust in his return from a right hamstring strain, and the Ravens routed the Miami Dolphins 28-6.
item.dc:creator: ALANIS THAMES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Saints' rookie quarterback reveals wife's blunt reaction after he was named starter
item.description: New Orleans rookie quarterback Tyler Shough revealed what his wife said when they learned he would be making his first start on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Foot note in the outfield: Toronto's Davis Schneider skips shoes a day before playing for title
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A day before playing for a World Series title, Davis Schneider went barefoot in the park. Toronto players arrived at Rogers Centre at about 8 a.m. Thursday after a red-eye flight from Los Angeles that followed their 6-1 win over the Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Denny Hamlin races for his dying father's last chance to see him win a NASCAR championship
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — Dennis Hamlin took out multiple mortgages on his Virginia home, maxed out every credit card and nearly went broke trying to get his son into NASCAR.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Thunder guard Nikola Topic diagnosed with testicular cancer and undergoing chemotherapy
item.description: OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) — Oklahoma City Thunder guard Nikola Topic has been diagnosed with testicular cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy. Sam Presti, the team's general manager, announced the diagnosis on Thursday. Topic had a testicular procedure earlier in the month.
item.dc:creator: CLIFF BRUNT, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Injured George Springer on track to play in Game 6 for Blue Jays, manager says
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Injured Blue Jays designated hitter George Springer is on track to play in Game 6 of the World Series on Friday, Toronto manager John Schneider said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Bears sign veteran DB to shore up injury-riddled secondary
item.description: The Chicago Bears have signed defensive back C.J. Gardner-Johnson to the active roster to help bolster their depleted secondary ahead of their matchup with the Cincinnati Bengals.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Logan Cooley signs 8-year, $80-million extension
item.description: The Utah Mammoth announced that center, Logan Cooley, will be signing an eight-year contract extension with the team.
item.dc:creator: Ava Hart, ABC 4

item.title: Utah's 7-game winning streak ends with 6-3 loss to Oilers
item.description: EDMONTON (ABC4 Sports) - Connor McDavid scored two goals for the Edmonton Oilers, who ended the Utah Mammoth's seven-game winning streak with a 6-3 come-from-behind victory at Rogers Place on Tuesday. This was Utah's first loss since October 13th.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Connor Bedard scores 3 times as the Blackhawks knock off the Senators 7-3
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Connor Bedard had three goals and an assist in his first career hat trick, and the Chicago Blackhawks beat the Ottawa Senators 7-3 on Tuesday night. Frank Nazar and defenseman Louis Crevier each had a goal and an assist for Chicago in its third win in four games.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Fan at Penguins game hospitalized after falling from upper concourse
item.description: A fan at Monday night's game between the Pittsburgh Penguins and St. Louis Blues was taken to a hospital after falling from the upper concourse at PPG Paints Arena.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Questionable officiating outshines Bucs win in New Orleans
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers left New Orleans with a dominant 23-3 victory over the Saints, but a pair of questionable calls by NFL officials kept it from being even worse for the home team.
item.dc:creator: Garrett Phillips, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Markkanen scores 51 as Jazz beat Suns in overtime, 138-134
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - Lauri Markkanen scored a career-high 51 points, the first Jazz player to reach 50 in the regular season since Karl Malone in 1998, and Utah beat the Phoenix Suns 138-134 in overtime on Monday night.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: NBA at the mercy of FBI in gambling scandal: Stephen A. Smith
item.description: Patel, the FBI director, called out Smith after he said that the arrests may have been a part of President Trump's revenge for all the backlash he receives.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Catching, running and stopping the football: 3 Takeaways from the Bears' loss in Baltimore
item.description: The Chicago Bears' offense struggled against the Ravens, but Rome Odunze was a bright spot, while the defense was unable to rely on turnovers to win, and D'Andre Swift needs to find success running inside the tackles to contribute to winning football games.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9
